name: Shakir
text: Alif Lam Ra. These are the verses of the Book that makes (things) manifest.

name: Shakir
text: Surely We have revealed it-- an Arabic Quran-- that you may understand.

name: Shakir
text: We narrate to you the best of narratives, by Our revealing to you this Quran, though before this you were certainly one of those who did not know.

name: Shakir
text: When Yusuf said to his father: O my father! surely I saw eleven stars and the sun and the moon-- I saw them making obeisance to me.

name: Shakir
text: He said: O my son! do not relate your vision to your brothers, lest they devise a plan against you; surely the Shaitan is an open enemy to man.

name: Shakir
text: And thus will your Lord choose you and teach you the interpretation of sayings and make His favor complete to you and to the children of Yaqoub, as He made it complete before to your fathers, Ibrahim and Ishaq; surely your Lord is Knowing, Wise.

name: Shakir
text: Certainly in Yusuf and his brothers there are signs for the inquirers.

name: Shakir
text: When they said: Certainly Yusuf and his brother are dearer to our father than we, though we are a (stronger) company; most surely our father is in manifest error:

name: Shakir
text: Slay Yusuf or cast him (forth) into some land, so that your father's regard may be exclusively for you, and after that you may be a righteous people.

name: Shakir
text: A speaker from among them said: Do not slay Yusuf, and cast him down into the bottom of the pit if you must do (it), (so that) some of the travellers may pick him up.

name: Shakir
text: They said: O our father! what reason have you that you do not trust in us with respect to Yusuf? And most surely we are his sincere well-wishers:

name: Shakir
text: Send him with us tomorrow that he may enjoy himself and sport, and surely we will guard him well.

name: Shakir
text: He said: Surely it grieves me that you should take him off, and I fear lest the wolf devour him while you are heedless of him.

name: Shakir
text: They said: Surely if the wolf should devour him notwithstanding that we are a (strong) company, we should then certainly be losers.

name: Shakir
text: So when they had gone off with him and agreed that they should put him down at the bottom of the pit, and We revealed to him: You will most certainly inform them of this their affair while they do not perceive.

name: Shakir
text: And they came to their father at nightfall, weeping.

name: Shakir
text: They said: O our father! surely we went off racing and left Yusuf by our goods, so the wolf devoured him, and you will not believe us though we are truthful.

name: Shakir
text: And they brought his shirt with false blood upon it. He said: Nay, your souls have made the matter light for you, but patience is good and Allah is He Whose help is sought for against what you describe.

name: Shakir
text: And there came travellers and they sent their water-drawer and he let down his bucket. He said: O good news! this is a youth; and they concealed him as an article of merchandise, and Allah knew what they did.

name: Shakir
text: And they sold him for a small price, a few pieces of silver, and they showed no desire for him.

name: Shakir
text: And the Egyptian who bought him said to his wife: Give him an honorable abode, maybe he will be useful to us, or we may adopt him as a son. And thus did We establish Yusuf in the land and that We might teach him the interpretation of sayings; and Allah is the master of His affair, but most people do not know.

name: Shakir
text: And when he had attained his maturity, We gave him wisdom and knowledge: and thus do We reward those who do good.

name: Shakir
text: And she in whose house he was sought to make himself yield (to her), and she made fast the doors and said: Come forward. He said: I seek Allah's refuge, surely my Lord made good my abode: Surely the unjust do not prosper.

name: Shakir
text: And certainly she made for him, and he would have made for her, were it not that he had seen the manifest evidence of his Lord; thus (it was) that We might turn away from him evil and indecency, surely he was one of Our sincere servants.

name: Shakir
text: And they both hastened to the door, and she rent his shirt from behind and they met her husband at the door. She said: What is the punishment of him who intends evil to your wife except imprisonment or a painful chastisement?

name: Shakir
text: He said: She sought to make me yield (to her); and a witness of her own family bore witness: If his shirt is rent from front, she speaks the truth and he is one of the liars:

name: Shakir
text: And if his shirt is rent from behind, she tells a lie and he is one of the truthful.

name: Shakir
text: So when he saw his shirt rent from behind, he said: Surely it is a guile of you women; surely your guile is great:

name: Shakir
text: O Yusuf! turn aside from this; and (O my wife)! ask forgiveness for your fault, surely you are one of the wrong-doers.

name: Shakir
text: And women in the city said: The chiefs wife seeks her slave to yield himself (to her), surely he has affected her deeply with (his) love; most surely we see her in manifest error.

name: Shakir
text: So when she heard of their sly talk she sent for them and prepared for them a repast, and gave each of them a knife, and said (to Yusuf): Come forth to them. So when they saw him, they deemed him great, and cut their hands (in amazement), and said: Remote is Allah (from imperfection); this is not a mortal; this is but a noble angel.

name: Shakir
text: She said: This is he with respect to whom you blamed me, and certainly I sought his yielding himself (to me), but he abstained, and if he does not do what I bid him, he shall certainly be imprisoned, and he shall certainly be of those who are in a state of ignominy.

name: Shakir
text: He said: My Lord! the prison house is dearer to me than that to which they invite me; and if Thou turn not away their device from me, I will yearn towards them and become (one) of the ignorant.

name: Shakir
text: Thereupon his Lord accepted his prayer and turned away their guile from him; surely He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

name: Shakir
text: Then it occurred to them after they had seen the signs that they should imprison him till a time.

name: Shakir
text: And two youths entered the prison with him. One of them said: I saw myself pressing wine. And the other said: I saw myself carrying bread on my head, of which birds ate. Inform us of its interpretation; surely we see you to be of the doers of good.

name: Shakir
text: He said: There shall not come to you the food with which you are fed, but I will inform you both of its interpretation before it comes to you; this is of what my Lord has taught me; surely I have forsaken the religion of a people who do not believe in Allah, and they are deniers of the hereafter:

name: Shakir
text: And I follow the religion of my fathers, Ibrahim and Ishaq and Yaqoub; it beseems us not that we should associate aught with Allah; this is by Allah's grace upon us and on mankind, but most people do not give thanks:

name: Shakir
text: O my two mates of the prison! are sundry lords better or Allah the One, the Supreme?

name: Shakir
text: You do not serve besides Him but names which you have named, you and your fathers; Allah has not sent down any authority for them; judgment is only Allah's; He has commanded that you shall not serve aught but Him; this is the right religion but most people do not know:

name: Shakir
text: O my two mates of the prison! as for one of you, he shall give his lord to drink wine; and as for the other, he shall be crucified, so that the birds shall eat from his head, the matter is decreed concerning which you inquired.

name: Shakir
text: And he said to him whom he knew would be delivered of the two: Remember me with your lord; but the Shaitan caused him to forget mentioning (it) to his lord, so he remained in the prison a few years.

name: Shakir
text: And the king said: Surely I see seven fat kine which seven lean ones devoured; and seven green ears and (seven) others dry: O chiefs! explain to me my dream, if you can interpret the dream.

name: Shakir
text: They said: Confused dreams, and we do not know the interpretation of dreams.

name: Shakir
text: And of the two (prisoners) he who had found deliverance and remembered after a long time said: I will inform you of its interpretation, so let me go:

name: Shakir
text: Yusuf! O truthful one! explain to us seven fat kine which seven lean ones devoured, and seven green ears and (seven) others dry, that I may go back to the people so that they may know.

name: Shakir
text: He said: You shall sow for seven years continuously, then what you reap leave it in its ear except a little of which you eat.

name: Shakir
text: Then there shall come after that seven years of hardship which shall eat away all that you have beforehand laid up in store for them, except a little of what you shall have preserved:

name: Shakir
text: Then there will come after that a year in which people shall have rain and in which they shall press (grapes).

name: Shakir
text: And the king said: Bring him to me. So when the messenger came to him, he said: Go back to your lord and ask him, what is the case of the women who cut their hands; surely my Lord knows their guile.

name: Shakir
text: He said: How was your affair when you sought Yusuf to yield himself (to you)? They said: Remote is Allah (from imperfection), we knew of no evil on his part. The chief's wife said: Now has the truth become established: I sought him to yield himself (to me), and he is most surely of the truthful ones.

name: Shakir
text: This is that he might know that I have not been unfaithful to him in secret and that Allah does not guide the device of the unfaithful.

name: Shakir
text: And I do not declare myself free, most surely (man's) self is wont to command (him to do) evil, except such as my Lord has had mercy on, surely my Lord is Forgiving, Merciful.

name: Shakir
text: And the king said: Bring him to me, I will choose him for myself. So when he had spoken with him, he said: Surely you are in our presence today an honorable, a faithful one.

name: Shakir
text: He said: Place me (in authority) over the treasures of the land, surely I am a good keeper, knowing well.

name: Shakir
text: And thus did We give to Yusuf power in the land-- he had mastery in it wherever he liked; We send down Our mercy on whom We please, and We do not waste the reward of those who do good.

name: Shakir
text: And certainly the reward of the hereafter is much better for those who believe and guard (against evil).

name: Shakir
text: And Yusuf's brothers came and went in to him, and he knew them, while they did not recognize him.

name: Shakir
text: And when he furnished them with their provision, he said: Bring to me a brother of yours from your father; do you not see that I give full measure and that I am the best of hosts?

name: Shakir
text: But if you do not bring him to me, you shall have no measure (of corn) from me, nor shall you come near me.

name: Shakir
text: They said: We will strive to make his father yield in respect of him, and we are sure to do (it).

name: Shakir
text: And he said to his servants: Put their money into their bags that they may recognize it when they go back to their family, so that they may come back.

name: Shakir
text: So when they returned to their father, they said: O our father, the measure is withheld from us, therefore send with us our brother, (so that) we may get the measure, and we will most surely guard him.

name: Shakir
text: He said: I cannot trust in you with respect to him, except as I trusted in you with respect to his brother before; but Allah is the best Keeper, and He is the most Merciful of the merciful ones.

name: Shakir
text: And when they opened their goods, they found their money returned to them. They said: O our father! what (more) can we desire? This is our property returned to us, and we will bring corn for our family and guard our brother, and will have in addition the measure of a camel (load); this is an easy measure.

name: Shakir
text: He said: I will by no means send him with you until you give me a firm covenant in Allah's name that you will most certainly bring him back to me, unless you are completely surrounded. And when they gave him their covenant, he said: Allah is the One in Whom trust is placed as regards what we say.

name: Shakir
text: And he said: O my sons! do not (all) enter by one gate and enter by different gates and I cannot avail you aught against Allah; judgment is only Allah's; on Him do I rely, and on Him let those who are reliant rely.

name: Shakir
text: And when they had entered as their father had bidden them, it did not avail them aught against Allah, but (it was only) a desire in the soul of Yaqoub which he satisfied; and surely he was possessed of knowledge because We had given him knowledge, but most people do not know.

name: Shakir
text: And when they went in to Yusuf. he lodged his brother with himself, saying: I am your brother, therefore grieve not at what they do.

name: Shakir
text: So when he furnished them with their provisions, (someone) placed the drinking cup in his brother's bag. Then a crier cried out: O caravan! you are most surely thieves.

name: Shakir
text: They said while they were facing them: What is it that you miss?

name: Shakir
text: They said: We miss the king's drinking cup, and he who shall bring it shall have a camel-load and I am responsible for it.

name: Shakir
text: They said: By Allah! you know for certain that we have not come to make mischief in the land, and we are not thieves.

name: Shakir
text: They said: But what shall be the requital of this, if you are liars?

name: Shakir
text: They said: The requital of this is that the person in whose bag it is found shall himself be (held for) the satisfaction thereof; thus do we punish the wrongdoers.

name: Shakir
text: So he began with their sacks before the sack of his brother, then he brought it out from his brother's sack. Thus did We plan for the sake of Yusuf; it was not (lawful) that he should take his brother under the king's law unless Allah pleased; We raise the degrees of whomsoever We please, and above every one possessed of knowledge is the All-knowing one.

name: Shakir
text: They said: If he steal, a brother of his did indeed steal before; but Yusuf kept it secret in his heart and did not disclose it to them. He said: You are in an evil condition and Allah knows best what you state.

name: Shakir
text: They said: O chief! he has a father, a very old man, therefore retain one of us in his stead; surely we see you to be of the doers of good.

name: Shakir
text: He said: Allah protect us that we should seize other than him with whom we found our property, for then most surely we would be unjust.

name: Shakir
text: Then when they despaired of him, they retired, conferring privately together. The eldest of them said: Do you not know that your father took from you a covenant in Allah's name, and how you fell short of your duty with respect to Yusuf before? Therefore I will by no means depart from this land until my father permits me or Allah decides for me, and He is the best of the judges:

name: Shakir
text: Go back to your father and say: O our father! surely your son committed theft, and we do not bear witness except to what we have known, and we could not keep watch over the unseen:

name: Shakir
text: And inquire in the town in which we were and the caravan with which we proceeded, and most surely we are truthful.

name: Shakir
text: He (Yaqoub) said: Nay, your souls have made a matter light for you, so patience is good; maybe Allah will bring them all together to me; surely He is the Knowing, the Wise.

name: Shakir
text: And he turned away from them, and said: O my sorrow for Yusuf! and his eyes became white on account of the grief, and he was a repressor (of grief).

name: Shakir
text: They said: By Allah! you will not cease to remember Yusuf until you are a prey to constant disease or (until) you are of those who perish.

name: Shakir
text: He said: I only complain of my grief and sorrow to Allah, and I know from Allah what you do not know.

name: Shakir
text: O my sons! Go and inquire respecting Yusuf and his brother, and despair not of Allah's mercy; surely none despairs of Allah's mercy except the unbelieving people.

name: Shakir
text: So when they came in to him, they said: O chief! distress has afflicted us and our family and we have brought scanty money, so give us full measure and be charitable to us; surely Allah rewards the charitable.

name: Shakir
text: He said: Do you know how you treated Yusuf and his brother when you were ignorant?

name: Shakir
text: They said: Are you indeed Yusuf? He said: I am Yusuf and this is my brother; Allah has indeed been gracious to us; surely he who guards (against evil) and is patient (is rewarded) for surely Allah does not waste the reward of those who do good.

name: Shakir
text: They said: By Allah! now has Allah certainly chosen you over us, and we were certainly sinners.

name: Shakir
text: He said: (There shall be) no reproof against you this day; Allah may forgive you, and He is the most Merciful of the merciful.

name: Shakir
text: Take this my shirt and cast it on my father's face, he will (again) be able to see, and come to me with all your families.

name: Shakir
text: And when the caravan had departed, their father said: Most surely I perceive the greatness of Yusuf, unless you pronounce me to be weak in judgment.

name: Shakir
text: They said: By Allah, you are most surely in your old error.

name: Shakir
text: So when the bearer of good news came he cast it on his face, so forthwith he regained his sight. He said: Did I not say to you that I know from Allah what you do not know?

name: Shakir
text: They said: O our father! ask forgiveness of our faults for us, surely we were sinners.

name: Shakir
text: He said: I will ask for you forgiveness from my Lord; surely He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

name: Shakir
text: Then when they came in to Yusuf, he took his parents to lodge with him and said: Enter safe into Egypt, if Allah please.

name: Shakir
text: And he raised his parents upon the throne and they fell down in prostration before him, and he said: O my father! this is the significance of my vision of old; my Lord has indeed made it to be true; and He was indeed kind to me when He brought me forth from the prison and brought you from the desert after the Shaitan had sown dissensions between me and my brothers, surely my Lord is benignant to whom He pleases; surely He is the Knowing, the Wise.

name: Shakir
text: My Lord! Thou hast given me of the kingdom and taught me of the interpretation of sayings: Originator of the heavens and the earth! Thou art my guardian in this world and the hereafter; make me die a muslim and join me with the good.

name: Shakir
text: This is of the announcements relating to the unseen (which) We reveal to you, and you were not with them when they resolved upon their affair, and they were devising plans.

name: Shakir
text: And most men will not believe though you desire it eagerly.

name: Shakir
text: And you do not ask them for a reward for this; it is nothing but a reminder for all mankind.

name: Shakir
text: And how many a sign in the heavens and the earth which they pass by, yet they turn aside from it.

name: Shakir
text: And most of them do not believe in Allah without associating others (with Him).

name: Shakir
text: Do they then feel secure that there may come to them an extensive chastisement from Allah or (that) the hour may come to them suddenly while they do not perceive?

name: Shakir
text: Say: This is my way: I call to Allah, I and those who follow me being certain, and glory be to Allah, and I am not one of the polytheists.

name: Shakir
text: And We have not sent before you but men from (among) the people of the towns, to whom We sent revelations. Have they not then travelled in the land and seen what was the end of those before them? And certainly the abode of the hereafter is best for those who guard (against evil); do you not then understand?

name: Shakir
text: Until when the apostles despaired and the people became sure that they were indeed told a lie, Our help came to them and whom We pleased was delivered; and Our punishment is not averted from the guilty people.

name: Shakir
text: In their histories there is certainly a lesson for men of understanding. It is not a narrative which could be forged, but a verification of what is before it and a distinct explanation of all things and a guide and a mercy to a people who believe.
